radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CTA AORTA/BIFEM/ILIAC RUNOFF W/W&WO C AND RECONS
radiographic_examinations.findings: Visualized lung bases demonstrate dependent bibasilar atelectasis. Liver unremarkable, gallbladder surgically absent, 12 mm cystic lesion in pancreatic head likely a side branch IPMN, normal pancreatic duct. Bilateral adrenal glands normal. Kidneys enhance symmetrically without hydronephrosis. Small and large bowel normal without obstruction. Subcutaneous emphysema and foci of free intraperitoneal air likely related to recent laparoscopic cholecystectomy. No pathologically enlarged lymph nodes identified. Ectatic infrarenal abdominal aorta with mural thrombus causing luminal narrowing. Complete occlusion of left common iliac artery with reconstitution via collaterals; severe stenosis of right common iliac artery and significant occlusion segments of right superficial femoral artery. Small caliber calf vessels patent without significant atherosclerosis.
